div.p: Add a line for each function that you want feedback on when there is an exception.
For each of the lines, when the function is executed with its parameters, if an exception is thrown, the system will create an action of the defined type.

ul.li: Name: descriptive name of the action to perform.
Company: company for which the function is to be executed.
Users: responsible users to be informed of the exceptions.
Model: model where the function to be executed is declared.
Function name: name of the function to execute and from which its exceptions will be managed.
Function params: function parameters whose values are passed as a dictionary. Ex: {'param1': value1, 'param2': value2}. If the function has no parameters, leave only {}.
Action to launch: action to execute when an exception error is detected in the selected function.
Notify exception: if this option is disabled, exceptions will not be taken into account and the associated action will not be launched.
